doc:
Frank Bacon (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Bacon_(actor) 0 Frank Bacon (January 16, 1864 – November 19, 1922), was an American character actor and playwright who after years of relative obscurity achieved great success as he entered the twilight of his career. The 1918 play Lightnin', which Bacon co-wrote and starred in, set a Broadway record for the day of 1,291 performances and was still going strong on tour after more than 700 shows when Bacon was forced to bow out due to fatigue. His death from a heart attack followed a week later. Frank_Bacon ( January_16_,_1864 – November_19_,_1922 ) , was an_American_character_actor and playwright who after years of relative_obscurity achieved great_success as he entered the_twilight of his_career . The_1918_play_Lightnin_' , which Bacon_co-wrote and starred in , set a_Broadway_record for the_day of 1,291_performances and was_still_going strong on tour after more_than_700_shows when Bacon was_forced_to_bow out due to fatigue . His_death from a_heart_attack followed a_week later .
